instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Bouncing Betty)
threads.message:
This board is a pain in my ass!  quick 300mA bounce.   No shorts,  All rails measure good for the brief time they are alive.  All SYS PWRGD is present "while it in the bounce".  I cant find anything wrong with the ring of fire "3V3 switches"  I checked SMC Logic.

Something is shutting this machine down.  Does any one have input?
I have posted a video on my channel if you want to see it in action.

[URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GdMvaAZr3Nw[/URL]

I really hate boards like this!  At the moment I think I am madder at my Magic Trakpad in Windows.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Bouncing Betty)
threads.message: Does the board run in smc bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Bouncing Betty)
threads.message:
No it does not. 
 Tried that

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Bouncing Betty)
threads.message:
So it stays on starting in SMC bypass mode?
I'm not sure about your reply.
If yes, then SMC sensor issue.
Start checking <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> presence.

If never stays on, then try known good BIOS; full file, not only cleaning ME.
Also reball, or even change SMC.

VCORE pulses too?
Check for pulse at pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Bouncing Betty)
threads.message: in SMC bypass the failure is the same.
